title: Build ANY AI Agent with this Context Engineering Blueprint
description:
Using AI coding assistants to build AI agents should be straightforward - but if you’ve ever tried it yourself you know it’s not. There’s a lot more than you’d think that goes into creating truly production ready AI agents with tools like Cursor and Claude Code!

The problem isn't your coding assistant or the LLM - it's the context you're providing. Throwing requests out without engineered context is what leads to broken code. Context engineering solves this by giving your AI coding assistant a comprehensive blueprint upfront to follow detailed patterns, best practices, examples, and requirements that plausibly produce production-ready code from the start.

In this video, I show you how it all works by building a complete Pydantic AI agent using context engineering with Rasmus’ PRP (Product Requirements Prompts) framework. It’s not rocket science but boy is it powerful. I’ll walk you through the entire process of creating an AI agent from start to finish with a PRP blueprint I’ve personally crafted specifically for building AI agents.

The best part? I'm open-sourcing the complete Pydantic AI PRP template so you can use this systematic approach for any AI agent you want to build. Just like what I did with MCP servers in the last video! No matter what kind of agent you’re building, this template gives you the foundational, engineered context that makes AI coding assistants actually effective.
